channel.title: CyberNetSec - Cyberattack
channel.description: Latest cyberattack threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Akira Ransomware Gang Hits LG Energy Solution, Claims 1.7TB Data Theft
item.description:
South Korean battery manufacturing giant LG Energy Solution has confirmed it was the victim of a ransomware attack at one of its overseas facilities. The notorious Akira ransomware gang has claimed responsibility for the breach, alleging on its dark web leak site that it stole 1.7 terabytes of data ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: New "Autumn Dragon" Espionage Campaign Targets Southeast Asia
item.description:
A newly identified cyber-espionage campaign named "Autumn Dragon" has been targeting government and media organizations across Southeast Asia since early 2025. The operation, attributed with medium confidence to a China-nexus Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group, aims to gather intelligence relate...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Vulnerability

Read Full Article →

item.title: ShadowPad Backdoor Deployed via Critical WSUS Server Vulnerability
item.description:
An active intrusion campaign is exploiting a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-59287, in Microsoft's Windows Server Update Services (WSUS). Attackers, believed to be Chinese state-sponsored APTs, are leveraging the flaw to gain system-level access and deploy the sophistica...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Italian IT Firm Almaviva Hit by Cyberattack, 2.3TB of Data Leaked
item.description:
The prominent Italian IT services provider Almaviva has confirmed it was hit by a major cyberattack, resulting in the theft and leaking of nearly 2.3 terabytes of sensitive data. The breach has exposed information from several of Almaviva's clients, most notably Italy's national railway operator, Fe...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Cyberattack, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: URGENT: CISA Orders 7-Day Patch for Actively Exploited FortiWeb Zero-Day
item.description:
Fortinet has disclosed a critical OS command injection zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2025-58034, in its FortiWeb Web Application Firewall (WAF) that is being actively exploited in the wild. The flaw allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying system. In response to...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: SEC Abandons Landmark Lawsuit Against SolarWinds and its CISO
item.description:
In a surprising move, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has voluntarily dismissed its civil enforcement action against SolarWinds and its CISO, Timothy G. Brown. The lawsuit, filed in October 2023, had accused the company and Brown of misleading investors about their cybersecurity po...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Sinobi Ransomware Strikes US Manufacturer and Indian Tech Firm
item.description:
The 'sinobi' ransomware group has claimed responsibility for two recent cyberattacks targeting organizations in the United States and India. The victims are Croft, a U.S.-based window and door manufacturer, and CHANGEPOND, an enterprise software company headquartered in Chennai, India. Both breaches...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: CISA Adds Actively Exploited Fortinet FortiWeb Flaw to KEV Catalog
item.description:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added a critical OS command injection vulnerability in Fortinet's FortiWeb products, CVE-2025-58034, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. Citing evidence of active exploitation, CISA has mandated a one-week remedia...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Kenyan Government Websites Defaced in Coordinated Cyberattack
item.description:
On November 17, 2025, a coordinated cyberattack targeted and temporarily disabled numerous Kenyan government websites. The Ministry of Interior and National Administration confirmed the breach, which impacted the websites of the State House and ministries of Health, Education, and Energy, among othe...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: NSFOCUS Mitigates Massive 843 Gbps DDoS Attack on Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
Security vendor NSFOCUS has detailed its successful effort to mitigate a massive multi-vector DDoS attack that targeted a critical infrastructure operator in October 2025. The attack peaked at an enormous 843.4 Gbps and 73.6 million packets per second, sustaining high volumes for over 30 minutes. Th...

Severity: High

Categories: Cyberattack, Industrial Control Systems, Threat Intelligence
